Description: Solid-cast copper alloy aegis with two heads: Shu with a plumed headdress and Tefnut(leonine) wearing a uraeus and sun-disc; broad collar below extending into a counterpoise engraved with a representation of a seated goddess and a fish.
Curator's comments: Published: Andrews, Amulets of Ancient Egypt (1994): fig.40
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
